comments:
All preference commands (list, set, get, unset) yield an IllegalAccessException when the PDE plugin is installed. Here's the stacktrace:

> buckminster --displaystack listpreferences
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Plug-in "org.eclipse.buckminster.pde" was unable to instantiate class "org.eclipse.buckminster.pde.prefs.TargetNLHandler".
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.RegistryStrategyOSGI.throwException(RegistryStrategyOSGI.java:180)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.osgi.RegistryStrategyOSGI.createExecutableExtension(RegistryStrategyOSGI.java:172)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry.createExecutableExtension(ExtensionRegistry.java:787)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElement.java:243)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:51)
        at org.eclipse.buckminster.cmdline.prefs.PreferenceMappingManager.findAllMappings(PreferenceMappingManager.java:76)
        at org.eclipse.buckminster.cmdline.prefs.PreferenceMappingManager.<init>(PreferenceMappingManager.java:61)
        at org.eclipse.buckminster.cmdline.prefs.PreferenceMappingManager.getInstance(PreferenceMappingManager.java:48)
        at org.eclipse.buckminster.cmdline.prefs.ListPreferences.run(ListPreferences.java:54)
Some constructors used default access mode. They were changed so that they now use public access mode.

traces.message: Plug-in "org.eclipse.buckminster.pde" was unable to instantiate class "org.eclipse.buckminster.pde.prefs.TargetNLHandler".
